website_summaries.verdict: The very basic Amazon Fire 7 Kids Edition tablet has great software for kids and parents, but the slightly more expensive 8-inch version is a better all-around pick.
pros: This very low-cost tablet includes a wealth of extras, including deep parental controls, a no-questions-asked two-year warranty and Amazon's excellent FreeTime Unlimited service
Onboard storage is expandable via microSD card
cons: The slightly larger, more expensive Fire HD 8 has a better display and audio, and runs faster
The Kids Edition costs significantly more than the otherwise identical standard version
There are the same app store limitations as the other Amazon Fire tablets

customer_reviews.title: Very slow, and design is awful
customer_reviews.text: Update: we returned our tablet. After speaking with a customer service rep about how slow the tablet is, she told us it’s designed to be that slow and she herself was more happy with the tablet she bought from walmart. Maybe it’s befause it’s a base model, but I figure it shouldn’t run THAT slowly. We’re really unhappy with this tablet. It’s very slow and confusing to use. We figured a little tablet for our daughter would be super fun for her but we can’t operate it! Restrictions for the children’s profile isn’t nearly what it needs to be. Interface and design is clunky and unintuitive. We regret buying this and wish we had bought an iPad.
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: This Kindle works great when you have it
customer_reviews.text: This Kindle works great when you have it. However the 2 year worry free guarantee is a joke. I recently had to send my daughters in to be replaced because the screen was cracked. I was promised it be back in 5 days its now going on 2 weeks!! I have also had to contact Amazon 2 additional times to see where my device is. I hoping they can get it right this time. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Lecia Orr

customer_reviews.title: Cannot recommend, tablet did not work at all.
customer_reviews.text: This did not work for my family at all. Every app I tried to install either failed and gave an error message or would immediately close after opening. The device frequently shut itself off for no apparent reason. Honestly shocked at how frustrating this has been. There seems to be no way at all to load applications or videos to the child account, even on the parent account everything was a chore. I have to assume I have a defective unit but I'm going to look elsewhere for a replacement because I can't put myself through this again.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Murby

customer_reviews.title: Requires credit card information to get through set up-2 months later doesn't charge
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed because you have to enter credit card information during the set up. This was a gift. The recipient family doesn't have a credit card. Update-the device stopped charging after 2 months. Working with customer service to get a replacement is a joke. They need the email address associated with setting up the device. Really? It was a GIFT I DON'T KNOW that information. I guess worry free and hassle free guarantee is NOT the same. Spoke with 3 customer service people to get shipping label. I hope my grandson doesn't like this thing too much because I am never buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Mine stopped charging
customer_reviews.text: It was nice while it lasted, but it stopped taking a charge after about 6 months and the seller made me jump through hoops to replace it. They were insistent that I wasn't using the right charger etc.,etc. Per their instructions,I sent it in the protective case and they sent back a new one without it. It took over a month to get the case replaced and in the meantime my child dropped it and broke the screen. He's been using it, but now it has stopped taking a charge again and now its out of warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Shellnut

customer_reviews.title: Parental Controls don't work.
customer_reviews.text: "Parental Controls" are a joke. They do not allow you to control the content the tablet displays to your children. All you get to do is tell it what age level of content you want available to your child, and then Amazon's development team gets to decide what content your child has access to. If you don't want them watching something at Amazon thinks is appropriate to the age levels you've selected, too bad, they can't. You could change the age level, but then maybe you're losing a bunch of content that you do want. These aren't parental controls, they're Amazon controls.
customer_reviews.author: DR

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for your young kid
customer_reviews.text: My three-year old loves it. We got him one just before a trip and it was perfect to keep him occupied. The Freetime is great as all the apps are age appropriate and no need to worry an app is not appropriate (the most frustrating thing with other tablets in downloading an app that is too advanced and my kid getting frustrated). The case is thick yet lite, perfect weight and size for his little hands (and nice to know it has a replacement warranty).
customer_reviews.author: TOMMASO TRINCHIERI

customer_reviews.title: Utter crap RIP OFF design.
customer_reviews.text: People have low expectation if they think this is a good kids tablet interface. It DOES NOT, I repeat DOES NOT auto boot into kids mode. It boots into adult mode WTF (face palm). In "freetime" mode the kid can just click on apps to download, HOWEVER because there is a huge lag and it doesn't do anything to let the kid know something happened like any proper UX would, the kid just clicks on more apps waiting for something to happen. Who was UX lead who made this crap? (You suck!) Pop up some mini game while they wait or something.
customer_reviews.author: Zezba

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this for your kid!
customer_reviews.text: This Kindle is the worst, especially for kids. It freezes constantly, which requires us to restart it 6-10 times per day. None of the kids apps work if you are not on WiFi, and since we bought it to entertain our son while in the car it is useless. I tried Returning it, but Amazon won't let you return it! They send you to tech support, who tell you to do a hard reset and reinstall all of your apps. Guesss what? That doesn't fix the problem Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: nic4asu

customer_reviews.title: One happy Princess
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 1 yes old and she loves it. It is so easy to use. And the over night shipping was great since we where on vacation when I brought it.
customer_reviews.author: starr alexander

customer_reviews.title: Rejected by four-year-old granddaughter
customer_reviews.text: We got this for my four-year-old granddaughter, who tried it out, but rejected it the first day. She would much rather get on a regular tablet and go on You Tube and find stuff herself. This Fire 7 Kid Tablet does not allow you to go on the internet and find your own stuff, but rather, limits the user to very few options. We returned it to Best Buy where we got it. My granddaughter personally handed it to the cashier, saying that she does not like it. We got a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: David N. Pearl

customer_reviews.title: Also like the fact that it came with the 2yr protection ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 3yr old autistic son to replace a Samsung Kids Tablet that he'd destroyed. Was really impressed with how tough the case appeared to be & the amount of apps available on Freetime for kids his age. Also like the fact that it came with the 2yr protection plan at no additional charge
customer_reviews.author: Katie Graham

customer_reviews.title: This is a bug that can easily be fixed
customer_reviews.text: The apps don't shut off when you hit the power button. This is a bug that can easily be fixed, but until then our kiddo inadvertently drains the battery because of it. Otherwise it's perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Michael N. Haines

customer_reviews.title: You do need Amazon Prime to see the videos
customer_reviews.text: You do need Amazon Prime to see the videos. Without it, for a child, it's very frustrating as you can't hide the "videos tab", and the kids will keep trying to open them but it won't work. One third of the content, useless. Also, some video apps, like the "Disney Now" app, does not work outside USA. Actually, most of the content is only in English, so, if you select a language la "Spanish", most apps will still be in English.
customer_reviews.author: Rodriguez Ruano Stuardo Josue

customer_reviews.title: Nice. I'm also a prime member but unfortunately the ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice. I'm also a prime member but unfortunately the features don't work where I live in the Bahamas. So it was a big disappointment and waste of money for me. But I could imagine how lovely it would've been for my daughter if the features worked.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I bought three of these for my three young boys ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of these for my three young boys (7,4,4) and I can't believe there is no way to have mp3 music play on the kid's profile. I thought this would be a no-brainer so I never researched it. I am strongly considering returning these for a galaxy or ipad. How could amazon NOT include such a basic necessay feature??
customer_reviews.author: Joe L. Gregoriou

customer_reviews.title: Don`t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these and BOTH needed to be replaced after a few months because the charging port stopped working. AFTER they were replaced it didn`t take long before they were doing the SAME thing and are now worthless again because they won`t charge and I no longer have the option to return them. I am starting to loose faith in products by Amazon. UPDATE I found out that these are still under warranty and I would like a refund as I already bought new tablets from a different company, but amazon has made communication impossible. They obviously are trying to avoid the problem until the warranty expires.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Storm

customer_reviews.title: You can't watch the thousands of videos
customer_reviews.text: It works like a nice kid's tablet. I like the restrictions already built in, the cover case and the battery life. what offends me with this device is the lack of information about what actually works where! This is supposed to be a device that can keep children busy but you can't download videos even though it comes with a year long subscription. Streaming is not possible outside US, UK and Germany which is not even in small print in the long epistle written on the sales page for this device. If you live or intend to use this device outside the afore mentioned coutries, do not purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: 5 months later no longer charges
customer_reviews.text: My son loves it and the case seems sturdy. It seems limited with what it can do which is okay since it's for my son. I don't have to worry about him ending up on an app or site I don't want him on. My problem is that after only 5 months it is no longer charging. It's heartbreaking having to explain this to him when he brings it to me excited to play his games or watch his shows. I have tried multiple chargers and outlets.
customer_reviews.author: Keroppi

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy unless you like wasting your money!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Only had for 3 months and it won’t charge! Useless. My daughter is so sad she can’t use her tablet. I contacted amazon to let them know of the problem and They are just ignoring me. Update ****** Amazon contacted me and they are sending a new tablet! Changed from 1star to 3 star hopefully the next one works!
customer_reviews.author: Jenn T

customer_reviews.title: A terrific bargain
customer_reviews.text: This product is great! The case is heavy and durable. It feels like either silicone or rubber. The tablet is a real Kindle Fire, just like you or I would buy There is a year's worth of Amazon FreeTime, a service designed especially for kids with books, videos, and games that are designed to be age appropriate though you can hand tailor your experience. The only caveat: Buy the 32Gig kid's tablet if you can because there is so much to choose from, and a front and rear camera, that children can quickly fill the tablet and you'll end up needing to clear space. It's happened to us already.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Riva

customer_reviews.title: Charging port doesnt last
customer_reviews.text: We've had now four of these kids tablets because the tablet ALWAYS stops charging after a few months. But they at least would just immediately ship you a refurbished one so it wasn't too much of an ordeal... just had to get o the chat every few months and tell them yet another one stopped charging. But now they changed it so you have to ship it to them first and allow them to try and "repair" it. It's no longer worth it for me. The charging port goes out far too often for all that. I wouldn't suggest this tablet to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Macy R.

customer_reviews.title: Good for help your child to excel with reading!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! it forces my child to read more according to how I set the parental controls and I love that it allows me to set a time to shut off! easy to operate as well and very comfy to hold in your hands. I also love the definition assistance it provides in the reading section for your child to learn more vocabulary.......
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We have 3 of these one in each color
customer_reviews.text: We have three of these tablets with the biggest memory card we could find. I’m torn on what rating to give because they’re very durable with the case however it’s very slow. Even when i thought I was buying the best possible capacity and I got the best memory cards I could find it doesn’t let me download apps it restarts it is just a very frustrating device. My husband wants to get a tablet for our fourth child and I am looking for something by apple or anything with good reviews. We are a major fan of amazon household but this is the one thing I’m not satisfied with.
customer_reviews.author: HEATHER

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality!
customer_reviews.text: They don't last very long and they will only replace with a refurbished one which lasts even less time. I have purchased 2 of these for my granddaughter and had them replaced 2 times each during the 2 year period. They simply do not hold up. The last replacement was handled with the utmost care and it simply stopped accepting a charge. You are better off buying a different tablet and purchasing a good cover for protection. Amazon could make a better product or they could replace with new tablets instead of refurbished. Very disappointed in this tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela T.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible charging port
customer_reviews.text: I have returned my child's tablet twice because the charging port stopped working, and it has stopped working a third time. It's only a year old. The second time, they kept it for a long time, and when I called to check on it, it seems that nothing was in progress at all to fix or replace. They put me on hold for a long time, then came back to ask me what was wrong with it again, and then I was on hold for another length of time before they told me they were sending the replacement. These are not reliable at all.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Harbaugh

customer_reviews.title: Find a better product
customer_reviews.text: Id suggest buying a higher gb or an iPad... Consistant issues with memory. We have 2 and they include the parent profile- each tablet is able to switch between profiles (for example if my sons is dead, im able to use my daughter's and just hit his icon)- great, right? No- it takes up more storage and hinders each tablets usage. For the cost- go else where. Amazon is really easy to work with but when you have a bad product- what can they do? They have a lot of software issues.. In hindsight it's an awesome idea and i bought the new one (for my youngest) assuming the bugs would be worked out. Nope. Buyer be ware.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Great device....bad Amazon did not have one-year service included set up on device.
customer_reviews.text: Bought as gift for my nephew. I liked it myself. He is 2 1/2. Immediately used it. Only complaint, my sister is not a prime member so on Christmas Day I spent 45 minutes on the phone with Amazon to activate the advertised one-year included apps. Embarrassing but all worked out. Bad business on Amazon's part not to have set up as advertised. If buy for someone else, be warned and not get the included year free. The device was set up for 30-day free trial. Amazon line helpful but took long time to override and set correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Tippi

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE THE NEW FREETIME UPDATE!!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazon just updated the Freetime App to make it essentially the same as the Prime Video UI. Which replaces icons with text descriptions for all of the categories. (So instead of a TV Set icon for videos, the child sees things like "Movies & TV You Might Like"). Which makes the user interface UNUSABLE for kids who cannot read! My daughter discovered the update yesterday (it was automatically installed yesterday), and was in hysterics for two hours last night, crying "Daddy, I Can't Read!" So Amazon's goal is to be the most customer-oriented company ever? Really? BEWARE!
customer_reviews.author: Bill The Ripper

customer_reviews.title: okay, not great
customer_reviews.text: These are great for not worrying about them breaking. But if you want to load android apps from the Google Play store you can forget it. And once the storage is full, good luck cleaning that up. The device maintenance is a nightmare. My kids can't hardly do anything anymore with the tabs, because it's always complaining about the storage being full, and I'm racking my brain trying to figure out how to clean up the storage, and I'm an IT guy. My wife wants me to buy Samsung tablets again for our kids, and just give the fire tablets away.
customer_reviews.author: David R. Mullins

customer_reviews.title: Great product watch the USB port though
customer_reviews.text: Kids tablets from Amazon are great and they have covered under warranty the problem but have had to return for bad USB charging port 4 times older kids tablets we have to not have this problem. I am hoping that this one has a design change to fix the fragility problem. Other than this and they have replaced tablet so I can not complain, tablet is great for younger kids with the padded case is very durable kids time gives them many things to do and try, it has developed into a great product.
customer_reviews.author: robert radcliffe

customer_reviews.title: So much for being designed for children! My 6 ...
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY!!! IF I COULD GIVE NO STARS I WOULD!!! On top of being nearly impossible to use with any website not preloaded- even ones used in a first grade classroom- the claim that it is a kid proof case is utter nonsense!! My 6 year old left her Kindle on the couch and it slid 3 feet off the couch onto the floor and shattered the screen- WITH THE PROTECTIVE CASE ON!!! Save yourself headache and frustration and just get an iPad mini with an Otterbox.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GARBAGE
customer_reviews.text: This thing is garbage. Fourth kindle, yes 4th. First kindle was replaced 3x because the refurbished garbage they kept sending me kept breaking. When i finally demanded a new kindle since my kindle that broke was new, not refurbished, they sent a new one. This one (same version) has a whole host of different issues. I can't believe I've been the only unlucky person with these things so i can't account for all the great reviews, but take it from someone who's not padding the reviews... THIS THING SUCKS. Get it if you want to thoroughly disappoint your small child and feel like having months of back-and-forth with Amazon Tech customer service who are incompetent and inept.
customer_reviews.author: Ro P

customer_reviews.title: Its ok but it could have more RAM and little faster CPU.
customer_reviews.text: Its OK but it lags often doing simple things like closing and opening apps or going through the menu. games like jetpack joyride lags often and thats an old game that is not demanding. I think it could do with a little more RAM and CPU power to say that this is going to last. Its built good especially for kids. battery is good but it charges slow. Speaker is weak. The screen is good and bright.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Lazo

customer_reviews.title: Addicted
customer_reviews.text: If you’re interactive with your child while using this (example: math flash cards, learning letters/shapes etc) and only download learning tools, this is great. Otherwise, it’s an electronic babysitter with racing games and other games that do not teach. The material is appropriate for children of all ages in my opinion. I recommend only downloading the games that are for learning or you may find your child begging to play video games that do not teach. Young children can become addicted to electronics and allowing them to have a tablet promotes this unless you use it with your child.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Apple product owners: Beware!
customer_reviews.text: If you’ve ever owned and Apple product, you will hate this! The software system is garbage. It is nothing but frustration trying to get it to do what you want. Just turning on and off the Wi-Fi, for example, is a nightmare and requires rebooting the tablet just so that it does what it should: turn the WiFi on or off! We are giving up and giving our kids our old iPads. The fact that this is cheap and comes with free replacement if damaged isn’t worth it for us.
customer_reviews.author: Marksreview

customer_reviews.title: Slightly disappointed
customer_reviews.text: These are great for the first 9-10 months but after that they start to act up. I have 4 of these kids tablets and every single one of them has had an issue. Issues such as charging, apps closing on their own, the whole tablet restarting on it's own, and more. The kids free time app is great but they don't keep up with updating the apps in it so my kids get frustrated and upset when they suddenly can't play their favorite game because they haven't updated the app within the app. Unfortunately after having these for a year now my husband and I have decided to buy our kids new tablets from a better company.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel K

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Parental controls
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Kids' Fire Tablet I've purchased for my 2 grandsons. The 6-year-old uses his for games and to read stories. The 3-year-old got his this holiday and loves playing games and using numbers and words. The parents like the Control Feature that tells the child that Time is Up for Today. Since the tablet sends the message, it's not a parent taking away the tablet! I bought different colors so the games/books are age appropriate and there is no question who owns which tablet.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed child- buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item for my 5 year old in April of 2018. I bought this to only be used with Amazon free time and it worked great for about 6 months. After the first 6 months we started having issues with games, books , etc not opening, not downloading etc. so I reset to factory defaults. This gave us another month or two of working off and on. Since then the tablet is near unuseable. Same issues .. games, apps, etc not opening. Really disappointing. I expected better. Now I have a very disappointed child.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Smith

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: I love these. They are sturdy and can handle usage by two little ones. I love the trial Freetime that comes with it and will use it after it expires. There are many different parental settings, the games are educational and fun. I do not have to worry about what my kids are doing on them. I have them set to turn off at a certain time and my kids have learned that's when to start their bedtime routine. It's actually made bedtime less stressful for everyone. I can use them when I want with the regular set up on my profile. 10 STARS of I could!
customer_reviews.author: Tonya

customer_reviews.title: Highly reccomend
customer_reviews.text: For anyone who is looking for a good tablet for their child, I highly recommend a Amazon Fire (kids edition). They come with a 2 year, no questions asked warranty. We have had our replaced 3x & on the 3rd time, my replacement got lost in the mail... I did have to buy a new one, but Amazon fully refunded me the cost & I have a new 2 year warranty now! & Amazon Freetime App allows me to closely monitor what content he sees, set time allowances, & even set up how many education apps/books have to be read before videos can be played. & his content can be used offline too!
customer_reviews.author: Briannon H.

customer_reviews.title: monthly subscription REQUIRED!! $$$$
customer_reviews.text: First you pay for the tablet, then you pay for the subscription (if you don’t the tablet becomes completely useless). Complete ripoff. Don’t be lured by the content and parental controls, ALL OF IT disappears when you stop paying for the monthly subscription!! Every app, show, book, and all parental controls. It’s a money grab, not a screen time solution.
customer_reviews.author: Alana K. Hawker

customer_reviews.title: Great kids tablet but software needs a serious update
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a year ago. This is a great kids tablet especially with FreeTime Unlimited, but my biggest complaint is the software is seriously overdue for an update. It is extremely buggy at times and features that are not very intuitive to use. Some specific examples of things that could use improvement: 1) loading content is very slow, 2) you can't add season of TV shows as favorites but instead you have to add each individual episode to favorites, 3) you cannot grant access to Prime Music Unlimited to the child account, 4) whenever wi-fi disconnects, the entire interface has to completely refresh and when it reconnects, it refreshes everything again.
customer_reviews.author: Eric S

customer_reviews.title: I value reviews, that’s why I want to warn you!
customer_reviews.text: After 2 years of owning this, this is my Christmas warning. Do not buy it. It is the worst. It worked for a month, then I spent an hour on the phone trying to fix it. I sent it back, they sent a refurbished one. They literally replaced my full priced piece of poo with a refurbished piece a poo. It has to be constantly rebooted either to reset it or find the WiFi. I have to enter the WiFi password almost every time. The whole process takes so long. Please don’t waste your money. I’m literally throwing this in a recycle bin the minute our Free Time subscription is done.
customer_reviews.author: Jennie D.

customer_reviews.title: What's the point of 2 year worry free if in 1 year the replacement period is over?
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 for my nieces and nephews. All 3 stopped charging after 1 year. Due to quarantine, I haven't been able to look at them until just now (5 months later, bc I've been quarantined out of state for work). Thinking not a big deal, bc they have a 2 year "worry free" ... I went to see about returning, and the window closed in February. But February marks "1 year" ... not 2... so I don't get it. Anyway, ridiculous that there is no "2 year" ... but the kindle Fire had issues leading up to it, freezing and crashing. Needed more internal memory and better RAM
customer_reviews.author: Zia Aud

customer_reviews.title: Slow
customer_reviews.text: It’s reallllly slow. I feel like there are better tablets out there that aren’t so aggravating to work with. I like tablets to load faster than this does. It doesn’t even respond to my taps right away either.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah W

customer_reviews.title: Very aggravating and LOTS of bugs
customer_reviews.text: The kindle works alright as a tablet, but the FreeTime is the most aggravating experience of my life! It has these wonderful features that work properly, about 25% of the time. I am constantly getting error messages and have to restart it, at least twice each day. Also, the space becomes limited so quickly and I purchased two micro SD cards for my two children’s Fire’s and 98% of the apps WON’T move to the card! I’m ready to sell them both.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed!
customer_reviews.text: Update 10/15/18. I should have listened. Tablet wont charge after month 6. Waiting on a replacement and repair. At first rep said it was"no questions asked" and I could get another, then she said they would need to try and repair original first. So is it really " no questions asked " or a repair??? Love the numerous apps provided in the kids interface. He absolutely loves it. Also like that I can switch over to parents side.
customer_reviews.author: kelove

customer_reviews.title: The free time is awesome and there is a ton of different things for ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 3 yr old daughter and I have set it up for her so that there will be apps and games available for her already on the device when she opens on Christmas. The free time is awesome and there is a ton of different things for her to try out. Very easy to use, although she has not tried yet, it is easy for me. The tablet's quality appears good, the case isn't the greatest quality but it is lightweight and protective so what more can you really ask for, the kids have to be able to hold it comfortably and it not be too heavy. Awesome product!
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: These wear out just after warranty
customer_reviews.text: Here's the thing, I LOVE these kids' fire tablets. I have bought three of them. But, there is one major problem -- where the power cord plugs into the tablet wears out, and when it does, it is always after the "if they break it, you return it" warranty AND no tablet/phone/computer place fixes the Fire tablets because they are so inexpensive. So, you wind up buying a new Fire tablet. I bought three because one went bad. Then, guess what? Now another one has as well. I am not buying anymore Fire tablets because they simply do not last. I wish these were made to keep rather than made to replace :-(
customer_reviews.author: KeepOnReading

customer_reviews.title: So far the durability and functionality is perfect. This item is just as described
customer_reviews.text: This is really a well thought out gadget for the kids. So far the durability and functionality is perfect. This item is just as described. The charge lasts maybe 4-6hrs of constant playtime. If I could change one thing about it though, is when it is on the child profile, access to other apps besides freetime would be a huge plus for my homeschool children. Freetime has lots of games, books and videos but limits my son from going onto other apps such as pureflix for educational material. Of course once you exit freetime there should be a PIN for the parents to enter in order to access it.
customer_reviews.author: Janelle Hart

customer_reviews.title: Warranty does not apply
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 2 of these tablets for my kids. They have both broken. Amazon replaced 1 and it broke again for the same reason, the tablet will no longer connect to the charger. I called Amazon and they will not stand by the 2 year guarantee, the device is only 1 year old, they advised that the warranty was voided when the new device was sent out, because it goes off the original product. BE ADVISED that the 2 year guarantee is a sham and Amazon will not stand by their product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Frustrated
customer_reviews.text: I have three kindle fire’s now. Two 8 and one 7. Recently got the 7 for my daughter. First one came and wouldn’t hold a charge for a day. Completely died with minimal use. My boys fire 8 last for days. Second 7 came after I returned the first (and argued with customer service because they wanted to send us a refurbished one two days after I bought the brand new one that didn’t work).... and this one hold a barge better, but nothing like my boys 8. So frustrated. Considering returning this one too. How could both 7 I receive be defective? Or is it just that the 7 is junk? Love my boys 8 but dodsapiunted in Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Lenny Fox

customer_reviews.title: Good Tablet for Children
customer_reviews.text: The tablet is a Christmas present so it hasn't really been used yet. I like the kid protected case for it - it seems very durable. I turned the tablet on so I could connect it to my internet so that it is ready Christmas morning. I like the child's account on the tablet and the fact that I can set a time for how long my child can play on it. I also like that the child's account can be turned off and it can be used like a regular tablet. Will update once my child gets to open the present and play with it.
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha McOwen

customer_reviews.title: HOW TO DELETE UNWANTED GAMES
customer_reviews.text: My grandson absolutely loves this tablet. However there are some games that are not suitable for him at this point. We would like to remove them. After a lengthily conversation with a customer service rep, this seemingly small task can not accomplished. After trying several things she suggested factory resetting the tablet. I elected not to do that because of the time involved in reloading all of the lost information. All I want to do is to delete games from the device. There must be a simple solution. HELP
customer_reviews.author: MsLady

customer_reviews.title: Light and durable. Great for kids or adults.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my one-year-old, go ahead judge me, but the apps we use on it a very music and learning oriented. Ultimately, this is just a Kinde Fire 7 in an awesome protective sleeve. My husband wants one for himself now. I do wish it came with a screen protector but fortunately, the gorilla glass seems to keep itself mostly scratch free. (it's the same glass that the fire phone was made out of and our's barely has a scratch on it after 20 kids (we're foster parents) playing with it.) This tablet doesn't really lag and is lighter than previous versions even with the foam case. I really like it and so does my little guy.
customer_reviews.author: Lillith Nightshade

customer_reviews.title: The best tablet your kids can have !
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend it for anyone looking for a good tablet for the little one, it’s really strong and fun , it has everything my daughter needs it , and the most part i LOVE it about it is the ( GOOD TO GO) so now my daughter can enjoy it anywhere without Internet , the other thing I really love it is the Amazon’s Warranty, it’s amazing, they sent Replacement within one day and no lot of questions!! Really really I recommend it for everyone I hope i can get the other one to my son ❤️❤️❤️
customer_reviews.author: Zeena

customer_reviews.title: Not very user friendly
customer_reviews.text: I really want to love this thing b/c my daughter adores it, but it's kind of a pain sometimes. At random moments it runs very slowly, or the buttons stop working altogether. I spoke with customer service and they taught me how to "clear the cache," which helps, but doesn't entirely solve the problem. The battery has a pretty short life, too. It does have lots of fun games on it, it's just rather annoying at times trying to get it to work properly.
customer_reviews.author: Dracollo

customer_reviews.title: Defective technology
customer_reviews.text: We had bought these for our kids for Christmas of 2017. We had the replaced (both as we bought two) at different times because they stopped turning on. One replacement immediately started showing the same issues when it first stopped holding charges and then stopped charging. The other one ended up breaking with the same issues later. We replaced one of them which they shared for a while and died. I ended up not further replacing them with this brand and gave my kids one of our older tablets (different brand) that has worked for them perfectly fine. I would not recommend this tablet for kids. The bumper is the nicest thing about this tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha

customer_reviews.title: Memory management may be tricky but great tablet for the price.
customer_reviews.text: We have four of these tablets. I bought three for the kids and then one for myself I liked it so well. I would give five stars but we did have an ongoing issue with memory management. The problem was with the cache build up for each app, but it you get the impression it is from storage. You have to clear the caches for each app individually. Unfortunately I had to go through several people to discover this. Every single person was pleasant and tried to help to the best of their ability. When I did get to a rep who recognized my issue she was extremely helpful and cheerful. I would give her five stars just for her.
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: won't charge, 2nd tablet in a row...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tablet for my son and the charging port felt loose and it stopped charging. I went through the hassle free warranty and sent it back to them, after spending a long time on the phone troubleshooting with Amazon support. Got the replacement and the replacement developed the same problem. It will not let me file a support ticket or request a return on the replacement, we had it for less then 10 months. With the first tablet, the kids played on it while charging so I thought maybe that weakened it, but with the replacement it has not been used much and I only charge it overnight when no one can touch it. So disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Andrzej Kowalski

customer_reviews.title: Grandkid loves it
customer_reviews.text: Picked this up for my 2 year old grandson for Christmas. It has held up for a year of all of the sticky gummy wet hands a kid can muster up and is still going perfectly. He has dropped it, spilled milk and tea on it, and again got every sort of food imaginable on it and it cleans up easily and continues to work without issue. It is tied to my amazon account and have had zero issues with him being able to purchase anything by accident. I still see all notifications on the lockout screen but again he has no access to purchase which was a big concern of mine. Perfect size and holds a charge well enough.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Kids Edition Kindle Fire
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is your regular Fire Tablet with a few additions to make it suitable for kids. If I wanted I could use it myself. There is an option for you to set up multiple kids profiles. In the kids mode there is a parental lock that you can enable to keep kids safe. Mine came with 1 yr free apps and 2 year no questions asked return if something were to happen to it. I love the ease of kindles which is why I purchased this one for my daughter. She is 18 months and knows how to navigate thru the apps so I obviously use the parental lock.
customer_reviews.author: CARRINGTON23

customer_reviews.title: Charger port WILL fail. Will be a complete hassle to used the "No Questions asked" return
customer_reviews.text: I talked to 3 different reps, each asking the same things like they don't talk to each other. FIRST BEING told it was out of warranty (Wasn't out of 2 year warranty). When confronted that it literally says 2 year warranty on the product page was told it must not be reflecting due to an error. Eventually (30+ minutes) led to getting a new one. This is the second kindle to have the same problem. The usb port WILL fail.
customer_reviews.author: NostalgiaGamer

customer_reviews.title: Runs slow.-Do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected. It runs very slow. There are a ton of distractions and unnecessary apps. We have enjoyed some of books as they have some animation and interact, so that was a fun surprise for my LO. I bought it on sale and used prime reward points so for what I paid it’s worth it but would be upset if I paid full price. ***update—doesn’t hold charge for very long. We’ve had it about 2 months and it’s constantly needing to be charged. Will not buy one again, our 3 year old iPad works better than this.
customer_reviews.author: katybean

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the worst item I have ever bought on Amazon. The tablet responds slow, the menus are unclear and after spending hours to figure out how to start the tablet up it turns out that it is full of terrible content that I am unable to remove. The user interface is not tailored to kids at all. I struggled to understand how to navigate the menus and needed to read several forums and manuals to make basic changes. I have ordered hundreds of items on Amazon and I have never sent anything back, but I will happily stand in line at the postoffice to return this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Joppe

customer_reviews.title: Hope you read the critical reviews
customer_reviews.text: It's cheap, so I wasn't expecting much, but even still, this product was disappointing. It worked okay for about 6 months, but now it can only hold a charge for about 30 minutes and must be fully recharged before another use. Even if my son only watches it for 15 minutes (starting at 100% charged), it will be dead before the next use. Actually, it is dead after 24 hours after a 100% charge regardless of whether it is used. If you are buying an Amazon tablet, you aren't getting much...
customer_reviews.author: Evan Wearne

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product! Limited storage space without a memory card but we use it for "research" and phonics centers in my classroom. Computers are still a little difficult for the kindergartners to use as they are still figuring out how to use a mouse and keyboard but having a set of four kindle fires allows them to explore the books and apps that I've downloaded ahead of time! The case stands up to dropping and I love that amazon will replace if they are broken. There are no home buttons like on iPads (something that had to be repaired 4 times when it was in use in the classroom).
customer_reviews.author: Caitlyn Anne

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my five-year-old son, I was very happy with the 2015 version and I was excited to see this new were version come out. However, even though I purchased the 16 GB tablet and a 256 GB SD card for it, the tablet is very choppy when playing any sort of game In Freetime. My son got very frustrated qith long loading screens and constant reboots when games freeze, now he doesn't want to use it at all; which is frustrating since I paid for a year of AbcMouse for him...
customer_reviews.author: Gesyca_is_Joy

customer_reviews.title: Amazon quickly replaced my Fire Kids Edition
customer_reviews.text: These are GREAT tablets for kids and I never worry about them seeing anything that isn't age-appropriate. They're very durable and offer great battery life. They aren't, however, waterproof as we learned when my son spilled water into the charging port. Since I've had the tablet for less than 2 years Amazon covered it under warranty. I submitted the warranty request on Thursday, shipped it to Amazon that afternoon, and received a brand new Fire on Monday morning. Great product and great service!!
customer_reviews.author: Jlucas

customer_reviews.title: He seems to love it. My only complaint is that I didn't ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my grandson. He seems to love it. My only complaint is that I didn't want this tied to my account because it was a gift and because I was the purchaser it was linked to my account which resulted in a few games being purchased through my account. Also I had to contact Amazon to notify them not to automatically renew and bill my account for the unlimited services after the warranty period ends. I feel Amazon should revamp how their system handle kindle purchases and they should not automatically be assigned to purchaser's account. These devices should be assigned to an account only after the product is registered.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Renee Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.text: The touch screen doesn't always respond to touch, and unlike other Kindles you don't get a start page that shows only the items you have purchased so you have todo go through all the items or recent items just to find your stuff, frustrating for me and for a one year old just impossible!!!! Also doesn't have all apps from baby first TV that are advertised on the TV program that you can get from Amazon! Also the baby first phone app doesn't have everything it's supposed to have!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend for Little’s
customer_reviews.text: My kids love these! And I love the parental controls! I can limit the hours of the day When they can acccess anything, how long they can spend not only total but on each area. i.e. videos, games, books, web, etc. you can even block them from any of those areas and require them to spend so much time in educational apps before they can use the other areas. Highly recommend! Especially for the price, (got them on sale for Xmas) features, Amazon kids freeware subscription free for one year and a two year warranty that covers any damage including dropping it or getting wet!
customer_reviews.author: MrsC

customer_reviews.title: Good tablet. And get Freetime for kids!
customer_reviews.text: Worth it! Freetime is very handy to keep kids corralled in the safer areas of tablet usage. You can even set daily goals and time limits. It's cheap too but Prime members get half off. There are so many movies, TV shows, books, apps, and games available for the kids in Freetime and you can choose the age range of these materials they can access. I feel the need to tell people about it because it is a safer alternative than letting young kids watch YouTube with its misleading titles and inappropriate content geared towards children. 👍 My daughter loves it!!
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: Bad charging port over and over
customer_reviews.text: The tablet has worked great. The only reason for the bad review is the charging port. This tablet has been sent back at least three times because you couldn’t get the charging cable to stay connected to charge. They fixed it under the warranty each time and works great for a couple months then does the same thing. It’s now out of warranty so we just have to prop it up so it keeps pressure on the cord. If not it will not charge. Poor design. If they would change this I wouldn’t hesitate to buy again.
customer_reviews.author: brodysdad

customer_reviews.title: Not useful
customer_reviews.text: We bought this tablet for my five year old, and returned it after less than a month. You can't search for games by name, so I couldn't find apps I knew he would like. There's just a wall of little icons to choose from. That would be fine except I can't sort by age, ratings, anything. We had to download dozens of apps to find any he liked. I ended up putting his stuff on an adult profile instead because the kid side was incredibly unwieldy. He hated it, I hated it, so we returned it and bought a Samsung instead.
customer_reviews.author: That Clever Chick

customer_reviews.title: Good for toddler, case is fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Good deal, pretty indestructible and great for my three year old. She's enjoying a couple puzzle apps, taking care of things apps, books, and finding things for herself. PBS kids video and game app is on there too, she loves it. I like I don't have to censor things much and it helps on long car trips. There's things she can grow into on there as well, seems like a good variety. The memory runs low at times but I just delete some things/restart and it's ok. You do have to get on wireless periodically for some apps to continue to work so that's a negative but only a few are like that.
customer_reviews.author: busy bee

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed with warranty
customer_reviews.text: The product worked fine, however, the whole reason I purchased was because of the "worry free replacement". Well I did not read the fine print and see that it is impossible to get the replacement! Both of my kids need theirs replaced, both had port issues and of course, one of them have a cracked screen - - again this is why i purchased this product for the worry free replacement! The only way I could try to contact was a physical address, where I mailed letters to get them returned to me!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SD Card Ain't Gonna Cut it....
customer_reviews.text: Go ahead, set it to save to you SD Card and insert one. Watch as it still loads up the hard drive and you are constantly fighting for storage space. Did I mention that the tablet has only been used by a 5 year old on Free Time? Here's the kicker: I have four of these darn things and I spend more time resetting them to their factory default settings than I should ever have to. Either buy it with more internal memory or give your kids Legos for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Storer

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 9 months
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement device for a Kid's edition bought in 2015 that failed. We got this at the end of September 2018. It failed in May 2019. Amazon will not stand by their product and refuses to replace or repair this device that failed after 9 months. This is the 4th Kindle Fire we have purchased that has stopped charging. This will be the last Kindle Fire we will ever buy.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My grand kids love these pads and if you start running short of ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the third Pad I have purchased for one of my grand kids as I have 8. When ever I have a problem all I need to do is call the Amazon help desk and they solve the problem. My grand kids love these pads and if you start running short of storage space all you have to do is order a larger memory chip.I have had problems and Amazon always replaces the tablet or they will fix it while you are on the phone by going into the pad from their end. The great thing is the parental control so you choose what the kids can and cannot play or watch.
customer_reviews.author: cindy

customer_reviews.title: Toddlers liked it, but...
customer_reviews.text: My toddlers loved it and spent far too much time on it. I couldn't figure it out... But honestly didn't put a lot of effort into learning the OS, so not faulting it for that. Removing 2 stars because it conveniently broke mere weeks after the replacement window ended at the one year mark. Tablet no longer turns on. No damage to the tablet itself and it's always been in it's super cushioned case. Husband mentioned that after a few months the speed really suffered as well and it took much longer to load videos and games.
customer_reviews.author: bcc

customer_reviews.title: Highly disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I would like a complete refund. I’ve had problems with this Tablet since day one. Now the charging port is loose. I’ve done everything as in managing my child’s time and I charge it up away from him. He gets it only 2 hrs a day to play only if he’s good. Once it’s fully charged I take it off charger in hopes to keep from getting the port damaged. If this isn’t going to last and I’m unable to get an email from amazon on this situation I recommend no one but any of amazons tablets as they’re not worth the money or hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Misty Diaz

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointed with the returns process for this "no questions asked ...
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed with the returns process for this "no questions asked warranty" item. I notified Amazon days ago that this tablet overheats and constantly crashes while being used by my son, and no one has called back as promised to set up the replacement. I have had great experiences with Amazon, but they need to change the way returns for this tablet are handled. As it is currently, the "no questions asked" is a straight up lie. I was asked many questions and still have a defective tablet.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bradford

customer_reviews.title: Best tablet!
customer_reviews.text: I love this. We bought a LeapPad last Christmas and it sat I played with. My kids are 6, 4 and 2. This is mainly for my 6 year old. I love that it gives me my own profile with all of my Amazon and kindle books and apps on it and then I can transfer the kid friendly apps right to the kids profiles. You can customize the timers however you want- if you want them to learn before they play or spend a certain amount of time doing books, videos or apps. It is the greatest! Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Terese

customer_reviews.title: Very Durable & the whole Family can enjoy
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my three-year-old grandson he walks around proud takes such good care of his tablet shares it with his big brother and would you believe it or not his mother can even log on and use it for herself what a great gift at a wonderful price very pleased with my purchase everyone in the family can enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: KIM WROBLEWSKI

customer_reviews.title: Good pad
customer_reviews.text: I got this for our first ever airplane ride that was about 6 hours long for our toddler that usually does not get much screen time, Incase things didn’t go smoothly. I downloaded a bunch of books, tv shows and games that were age appropriate. Fortunately, our little guy did great on the plane and didn’t need much screen time but we did use the pad a bit. During airplane mode, the battery actually lasted for a few days! When it is connected to the internet via WiFi, it seems to get used up quite fast.
customer_reviews.author: Sabina

customer_reviews.title: Device is unusable out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: This device is so slow it is unusable. You turn it on the side and it takes 10 seconds to swap from portrait to landscape. Change the volume? 5 seconds delay. Push an icon to open app? You are lucky if it opens within 20 seconds. My child thought they were looking at a still image. The reason they will refund it if it breaks is because they know your kids will never use it, because it is too slow. Oh an after a year magically charges for owning it start appearing on your credit card statement. Amazon should be embarrassed.
customer_reviews.author: Billkamm

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet, awesome case, but not "no questions asked"
customer_reviews.text: We love this tablet and the super squishy case! However, my son dropped his in the toilet and the touchscreen stopped responding. I spent almost a half hour answering questions for three different support teams before they finally sent me a return label. I'm glad they honored it and I am so thankful that this warranty is available (because the case can't save the tablet from the toilet!) but it was a hassle to get through the support chat when I had already tried all the troubleshooting steps and knew the circuits were fried (and told them that upfront).
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet for children
customer_reviews.text: Love it! It's perfect for my daughter. The games and videos are perfect to keep her entertained while in the car, and at any time it’s needed. The case has been tested by her dropping the tablet countless times and is still in perfect working order without a single break or crack in the screen. So glad we purchased it. Would definitely recommend and buy again if needed! The ability to have kids free time and the options for free games and books as well as tv and movies make this a perfect gift for any child.
customer_reviews.author: Slkupfer87

customer_reviews.title: It’s for Kids
customer_reviews.text: It def a kids tablet. Obviously. You’d have to tap the screen a with a little more pressure than you would to open an app. The lag time of when you tap an app to when it opens up is slow, but not extremely slow. Video graphic is ok. Not crisp clear, but ok. Volume on the tablet is really loud when you crank it all the way up so that’s a good thing. Camera and video quality is fuzzy in low light situations. Best to use the camera in good lighting. Parental control was easy to set up! The kids are happy with it so I’m not complaining.
customer_reviews.author: Song H.

customer_reviews.title: FAULTY USB CHARGERS!
customer_reviews.text: We have owned 3 of these since February 2018. One of them quit charging within 30 days. Amazon replaced it (painlessly). The NEW one quit charging within another 60 days. After doing a bit of online searching, apparently the Kindle Fire has some sort of USB faultiness epidemic in which many, many of these devices quit charging after awhile. Of the 3 Kindle Fires we have owned--2 of them quit charging nearly immediately! That's a 66% failure rate, which, in my opinion, is pretty high!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I’ve gotten A few Kindle Fires so I purchased this one when my son was old enough to want his own screen. However, the touch screen is terrible and everything seems to take twice as long as previous Kindles. My son is 5 and can navigate other devices fine, but this one had him crying in frustration. I usually let him play games and our videos on my phone while I struggle to read on the Fire. Typing is a true pain in the neck because of the slow responses. I’m typing this on my phone because I was read to hurl the Fire across the room. Overall I wish I’d bought a refurbished iPhone for him to play on.
customer_reviews.author: E. J. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: DON'T waste your money this has no ram! a memory won't help.
customer_reviews.text: bought this for my son. he has been using it on the weekends since christmas. i bought a 64g memory card. very soon messages started to appear about critically low storage. some apps just won't go on the memory card. and there is a group of "miscellaneous" files over 9gigs that can't be looked at or erased. not to mention all of the amazon bloatware. MY 4 YEAR OLD DOESNT NEED FRIGGIN ALEXA!! so the kindle always fill up even after 3 factory resets. it performs like crap and he can only play a couple games.
customer_reviews.author: rumbears

customer_reviews.title: Nice tablet only if i could use it with my Amazon acct
customer_reviews.text: Should allow customers to purchase without have Amazon account sync to the tablet what if the person your giving it to doesn't wish to have an Amazon account with there credit card information exposed. The games given should have been off line games as what happens if the child doesn't always have Wi-Fi and lastly before purchasing consumer should knw if you live out side of the countries listed the tablet will not allow you to access the free games and videos. The quality of the tablet is very nice however i can't use it unless i sync my Amazon account to it
customer_reviews.author: latanyadarville

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is limited and slow. The case protection is pretty good and my step-son did enjoy using it. However, Amazon refuses to honor the 2-year warranty. I followed the instructions and they returned the package, UNOPENED! I called customer service and they said it was not under warranty even though it says 2 years and it's been only a little over a year. I will not be buying amazon products in the future. HORRIBLE company and worse customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Winn

customer_reviews.title: Great Kids tablet, Fire OS could use some tweaks
customer_reviews.text: Really impressed with build quality and the case construction. Perfect size for little hands, 2 year old loves it. Only issues I have are with the OS, it should have touch lock app built in. Instead had to install Google play to install one. Secondly, there should be a way to hide things in Freetime (which is a great idea, just not perfectly executed), such as cloud apps and videos. And should be able to download offline videos in kids profiles, instead have to download and watch in parent account, at least for Prime Video and Netflix.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My Daughter loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I actually brought this item for my 1 year old! The quality of this tablet is really good. It has amazing protection and the warranty it comes with offers a replacement device if it is broken or just stop working. No questions ask! The app that is on here is really awesome. You get to see a lot of shows for free. The only complaint I have is that the battery dies pretty quick. But all in all it is a great tablet for a kid. I would highly recommend this tablet to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Charging connection is poor as is battery life.
customer_reviews.text: These tablets may be great but we’ve had problems with the charging connection and I am going to have to see about getting a replacement or getting it fixed. For a long time we thought it was our cord but recently discovered that is not the case. The battery life isn’t great either as it goes very fast. We bought this for a child so it has always been in a protective case and hasn’t been dropped or exposed to extreme temperatures. Was hoping for better
customer_reviews.author: Jinny

customer_reviews.title: Not as bad as people are saying
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why so many horrible reviews on here, we got this for out 2 yr old and she loves it. Yeah it’s a little slow at times but what tablet isn’t? Maybe people need to do a internet upgrade before complaining. I only have up to 50mbps internet and we have no issues. If the charging port is breaking maybe plug it somewhere where the kids can’t just rip the thing off the charge to use it. This is a great product in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Nery Leiva

product_meta.title: Fire 7 Kids Edition Tablet, 7" Display, 16 GB, Blue Kid-Proof Case - (Previous Generation - 7th)
feature_bullets: Up to $129 in savings on Fire 7 tablet, 1 year of Amazon FreeTime Unlimited, and a Kid-Proof Case, versus items purchased separately ? plus a 2-year worry-free guarantee
Not a toy, a full-featured Fire 7 tablet with a 7" IPS display, 16 GB internal storage, and up to 8 hours of mixed-use battery life. Add a microSD card for up to 256 GB of expandable storage.

The included 1 year of FreeTime Unlimited gives your kids access to over 20,000 popular apps and games, videos, books, Audible books, and educational content from PBS Kids, Nickelodeon, Disney, and more. Your subscription will then automatically renew every month starting at just $2.99 per month plus applicable tax. You may cancel at any time by visiting the Amazon Parent Dashboard or contacting Customer Service.
2-year worry-free guarantee: If it breaks, return it and we'll replace it for free.

Introducing Spanish language content in FreeTime Unlimited ? kids can now enjoy over 1,000 books, movies, and apps in Spanish that include titles and characters like Sesamo, Dora, Diego, Frozen, and more.

Kids can listen to thousands of hours of fun, educational and inspirational Audible books like Beauty and the Beast, The Snow Queen, Peter Pan, Rip Van Winkle, and more ? professionally narrated by their favorite characters, authors and celebrities.
Add even more content to your child?s profile in FreeTime to give them selected access to apps in your personal library, such as Netflix and Minecraft

Easy-to-use parental controls allow parents to personalize screen time limits, set educational goals, filter age-appropriate content, and also manage web browsing and content usage. Parental controls can be set on device or online through Amazon Parent Dashboard. Additionally, access all tablet features in the adult profile by entering your passcode.
